reviews.title: Great location, huge rooms, great breakfast!
reviews.text: San Nicolas was not our first choice of hotels in Ensenada but since all the other resorts were sold out we dubiously booked San Nicolas. We were pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness of the hotel and the rooms were above average - they were really big with two huge beds. The buffet breakfast on the Sunday was amazing and great value. You choose what food you want and watch the chef cook it. My boyfriend loved it and really made sure he got his value for money by going back for seconds...! The staff were extremely attentive and very friendly. The location is excellent - only a five minute walk to downtown Ensenada. We liked it that the hotel wasn't right in the centre as it would have been quite noisy if it was right in the middle of the bars etc. It is easy walking distance to downtown though and there is no need to get a taxi.

reviews.title: A fun Place to Visit
reviews.text: Although the hotel states it is a 'resort' and I guess by definition it is, since it has a pool, spa, restaurant and bar, we didn't feel that we'd like to stay at the hotel for our whole trip since there are much nicer restaurants downtown. Also, the pool was a little unclean and there were lots of noisy kids and very loud (awful) music playing during the day. The hotel was great for a place to sleep and eat breakfast but we wouldn't have been satisfied staying in the 'resort' the whole time. However, as it is so close to downtown, where there are lots of shops, bars and restaurants, it wasn't a problem. All in all, it was a pleasant stay and if we went to Ensenada again we'd happily stay there.
The San Nicolas is one of the best places I have stayed in. It is a VIntage hotel with great atmosphere. The historic murals on the walls between the 3 floors shouldn't be missed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the San Nicholas for three nights and had a great time. The hotel is not located in the middle of Ensenada, however we found that to be a plus since we were not bothered by the noise of the local bars etc. It is only is 10 minute walk to the "strip". The room was clean and rather large. After reading the reveiws of the pool we did not know what to think, however it was clean and looked very well maintained. My wife was able to book a massage under the waterfall by the pool and said it was devine! We ate at the hotel cafe for breakfast and lunch and found it to be above average. The machaca burrito is not to be missed! The staff was very nice and eager to help. The hotel could stand a bit of touch up here and there, but they have done a great job keeping this vintage hotel looking classic. We would stay there again.
reviews.title: True Baja Flavor
Great Mexican Hotel
reviews.text: I found the reviews here after I booked our room and got a little worried. But, my wife and I had a great time at the Hotel San Nicolas. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel seemed well maintained (none of the grafitti mentioned in another review). And, our room was in great condition. The color scheme was a bit dated (mauve), but our room was very clean. There was live music in the disco and it was filled with a mostly Mexican crowd. The hotel is a pleasant 20 minute walk to the heart of the downtown area. We were glad to be able to do the night scene and then enjoy the quiet of our hotel room. We didn't use the pool area, but it looked beautiful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved this hotel for all its unexpected touches -- dark wood-panelled rooms with interesting furniture looking out onto an enormous and totally kitschy pool; nice little happy hour, friendly staff. It's a bit of a hike from the main part of town, but not so much that I wouldn't stay here again. And it was such a relief to get to Ensenada after Rosarito. Tip: don't miss dinner at Manzanilla, once of the best meals I've ever had, at a great price and with an astonishingly friendly, super-talented & imaginative chef.
